intro: Erodium malacitanum, commonly known as the Malacitan commonweed, is a low-growing annual herb native to southern Africa. It features small, pinkish to reddish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the warmer months. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are often heart-shaped or ovate in form. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in open fields, roadsides, and along riverbanks. Botanically, it belongs to the family Leguminosae, which is characterized by its ability to fix nitrogen through symbiotic relationships with bacteria.
